item.title: What IT Needs to Know about OT/IoT Security Threats in 2020
item.description: Find out what IT needs to know about OT/IoT security in 2020, including the most active threats, their techniques and recommendations for mitigations.

item.title: Vulnerabilities in BMC Firmware Affect OT/IoT Device Security – Part 2
item.description: Nozomi Networks have discovered five new vulnerabilities in BMC firmware affecting the American Megatrends (AMI) MegaRAC software solution.

item.title: Threat Actor Activity Related to the Iran Conflict
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs has observed a 133% increase in cyberattacks coming from well-known Iranian threat actors including MuddyWater, APT33, OilRig, CyberAv3ngers.

item.title: The Year of the Defender – 2022 Predictions for OT/IoT Security
item.description: Our CEO shares his thoughts on the 2022 cyber landscape, from maturing critical infrastructure defenses to standardized security certifications.

item.title: The Long-range Disruption of Industrial IoT LoRaWAN Networks
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs team used drones to investigate attacks against a low-power radio frequency WAN technology widely used in industrial IoT networks.

item.title: The Federal Government Needs to Address OT/IoT Security NOW
item.description: To address escalating cyber threats, the federal government needs OT/IoT security – NOW. Read 3 examples of how Nozomi Networks protects federal control networks.

item.title: The Challenges of the Vulnerability Assessment Process in ICS Space
item.description: With the increasing number of CVEs released each year, organizations must prioritize a strong ICS vulnerability assessment process.

item.title: Snake Ransomware is Raising Concerns for Industrial Controls Systems
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs analysis of the EKANS/Snake ransomware found it that doesn’t attempt to spread, but instead relies on manual propagation.

item.title: Six Vulnerabilities Found in Axis Camera Systems License Plate Verifier Application
item.description: Newly discovered vulnerabilities affect the License Plate Verifier application on Axis Communications cameras.

item.title: Security Flaws Affect a Component of the Arduino Create Cloud IDE
item.description: Four vulnerabilities on the Arduino Create Agent software could lead to the elevation of privileges of a local user and the arbitrary deletion of protected files.

item.title: Protecting the Phoenix: Unveiling Critical Vulnerabilities in Phoenix Contact HMI – Part 3
item.description: Part 3 of a series on 14 vulnerabilities discovered by Nozomi Networks Labs affecting HMI products in Phoenix Contact.

item.title: Perspectives: Early Lead in Filling Global OT Security Demand
item.description: OT security is a top priority and buyers are demanding IT/OT converged solutions. Find out why Nozomi Networks is the preferred OT security solution.

item.title: Nozomi Networks Labs Takes on the Armasuisse ICS and Automotive Hackathons
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs participated in two hackathons focused on securing Industrial Control Systems (ICS) and automotive cybersecurity at the Cyber-Defence campus of armasuisse Science and Technologies.

item.title: Nozomi Networks Labs Discovers 9 Vulnerabilities Affecting Cognex InSight IS2000M-120 Smart Camera
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs discovered vulnerabilities in the Cognex IS2000M-120 industrial smart camera.

item.title: New Report: Top OT/IoT Security Threats and Vulnerabilities
item.description: Learn about the top OT/IoT security threats and vulnerabilities to speed up your understanding of the current threat landscape.

item.title: New Report: Ransomware, Vulnerabilities and IoT Security Threats
item.description: Find out what you need to know to fight ransomware and IoT vulnerabilities—and start improving your security and operational resilience.

item.title: New OT/IoT Security Report: Trends and Countermeasures for Critical Infrastructure Attacks
item.description: This OT/IoT Security Report from Nozomi Networks Labs covers cyberattack trends, vulnerability research, and best practices in remediation efforts.

item.title: New Report: Nozomi Networks Labs Finds Defenses Are Improving But Threats Continue to Rise
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs released a new security research report featuring analysis of public OT/IoT cybersecurity incidents over the past six months, as well as telemetry data from product deployments.

item.title: New BotenaGo Variant Discovered by Nozomi Networks Labs
item.description: Lillin scanner is a new variant of the BotenaGo malware that specifically targets Lilin security camera DVR devices, discovered by Nozomi Networks Labs.

item.title: Mapping the Ransomware Landscape: Global Hotspots and Emerging Threats
item.description: We look at the most recent trends in the ransomware landscape, based on the unique real customer data, including top ransomware families, most targeted countries and industries.

item.title: How Viable is Zero Trust for OT/IoT Networks? Is it a Journey or a Destination?
item.description: With the U.S. government’s move toward a Zero Trust Architecture, here’s what critical infrastructure organizations need to consider for their OT/IoT networks.

item.title: How to Ensure You Have Complete OT/ICS Asset Visibility
item.description: It takes a combination of passive and active cybersecurity sensors, OT/IoT protocol support, third-party connectors and AI-powered asset intelligence to achieve a complete asset inventory.

item.title: How to Build an IoT Honeypot
item.description: We detail five steps for setting up and using an IoT Honeypot in the real world using the Winbox protocol.

item.title: How to Analyze Malware for Technical Writing
item.description: In the world of cybersecurity, new threats are constant. To be efficient when analyzing new malware and publishing technical findings, it’s important to be prepared.

item.title: How IoT Botnets Evade Detection and Analysis - Part 1
item.description: Packing is a key technique to stymie reverse engineering botnet code. Learn more about packers used by IoT malware, and how to analyze packed samples.

item.title: Hardware Supply Chain Compromise in Human Interface Devices: Nozomi Networks + Hydro Québec Joint Research
item.description: Nozomi Networks and Hydro Québec's joint research demonstrates how threat actors can infiltrate the hardware supply chain to compromise PCs.

item.title: Hard Lessons from the Oldsmar Water Facility Cyberattack Hack
item.description: The TeamViewer app was used to remotely access Oldsmar’s water treatment system. This is a wakeup call for water districts everywhere.

item.title: A Comprehensive Guide to IoT Security
item.description: Learn what IoT security is, why it matters for critical infrastructure operators and best practices for securing IoT devices.

item.title: Flaws in Bently Nevada 3500 Allow Attackers to Bypass Authentication
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs investigated the security posture of Bently Nevada 3500 Systems. Here's what they found.

item.title: Five New Vulnerabilities Disclosed in Patient Monitoring Systems
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs discloses five vulnerabilities affecting attack surfaces on a Philips patient monitoring solution. Solutions from other vendors may have similar vulnerabilities.

item.title: Firmware Security Research: Dahua Facial Recognition Station
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs researches the Dahua Facial Recognition Station firmware for potential vulnerabilities.

item.title: Enhancing Threat Intelligence with the MITRE ATT&CK Framework
item.description: MITRE ATT&CK tactics and techniques are increasingly becoming a standard that helps provide OT and IoT threat intelligence.

item.title: Detecting New OT Threats: How To Do It Proactively
item.description: This blog post discusses various challenges that cybersecurity companies face when they need to detect new previously unknown threats and suggests possible solutions to this problem featuring our bleeding-edge technologies.

item.title: Demonstrating the Link Between Functional Safety and ICS Security
item.description: In industrial control systems (ICS) with no protection measures, it can be extremely easy for a threat actor to disrupt operations.

item.title: Critical Log4Shell (Apache Log4j) Zero-Day Attack Analysis
item.description: An analysis of the Apache Log4j vulnerability and the architecture of zero-day exploits (CVE-2021-44228) from Nozomi Networks Labs.

item.title: Could Threat Actors Be Downgrading Their Malware to Evade Detection?
item.description: Threat actors modify their malware to evade detection. This blog analyzes modification techniques used by Gafgyt (aka Qbot) malware.

item.title: CISA-Sponsored CVE Program Grants Nozomi Networks CNA Status
item.description: Nozomi Networks is a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA). The CVE Program is the international standard for identifying and naming cybersecurity vulnerabilities.

item.title: Breaking Research: LockerGoga Ransomware Impacts Norsk Hydro
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs has conducted a preliminary evaluation of LockerGoga. Read on to learn about this ransomware and our research team’s assessment of it.

item.title: BlackMatter Ransomware Technical Analysis and Tools from Nozomi Networks Labs
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs analyzes the BlackMatter ransomware executable to prevent critical infrastructure impact.

item.title: 9 New Vulnerabilities Impact Schweitzer Engineering Labs Software Applications on Engineering Workstations
item.description: Nozomi Networks Labs presents nine vulnerabilities affecting Schweitzer Engineering Labs (SEL) engineering workstation tools.

item.title: New Reolink P2P Vulnerabilities Show IoT Security Camera Risks
item.description: Learn about the IoT security camera risks identified in new research from Nozomi Networks Labs (ICS-CERT ICSA-21-019-02).

item.title: IEC 61850 Meets IEC 62351: Securing GOOSE Power Grid Weaknesses
item.description: Nozomi Networks CTO Moreno Carullo explains how IEC 62351-6 can be used to secure IEC 61850 GOOSE protocol defects & increase ICS security for substations.

item.title: Open Drone ID: Nozomi Networks Adds Support to Detect Drones with Guardian Air
item.description: Nozomi Guardian Air now detects suspicious ODID traffic and related drone cyberattacks.
